alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Floyd; Gordon; Murray; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 13 at 2:10PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Georgia, including the following counties, Catoosa, Chattooga, Dade, Floyd, Gordon, Murray, Walker and Whitfield. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A period of steady moderate to heavy rainfall is expected to impact portions of northwestern GA starting the morning of Wednesday and ending by the morning of Thursday. Rainfall amounts between 1.5" and 2.5" are expected with locally higher amounts possible. Previous rainfall has primed river, creeks, and streams for quick rises in this location, and the duration of the event, combined with the possibility of seeing bouts of heavy rainfall, will lead to the possibility of flash flooding in some locations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Floyd; Gordon; Murray; Walker; Whitfield
